page.title: 16The Alderney Lifeboat II
page.content: and life-jackets are worn always at sea. Crew are paid Â£4.50 for the first hour then Â£1.50 for each hour afterwards. Hon.Sec, coxswain or mechanic are the officers of the boat. It costs Â£20 to fire the maroons. There have been 54 rescues and 34 lives saved. There have been 6 wasted journeys. People do not have to pay to be towed in by {lifeboat.}The{lifeboat is a{BREDE}class {lifeboat. }It has a 12ft beam. Its draft is 4ft 3 ins and it carries 140 gallons of fuel and has a range of 140 nautical miles and speed of 21 knots. Weight 8 half tons. The boat was here for a year's trial and it was finally dedicated in 1985.The Duchess of Kent visited the island in May this year and performed a ceremony at the harbour.
